p: According to Khadem and Marles [ 16], gallic acid has antineoplastic and bacteriostatic activities, and salicylic acid exerts anti-inflammatory, analgesic, antipyretic, antifungal, and antiseptic properties. Protocatechuic acid has also been described as having several bioactivities such as anti-inflammatory, antifungal, and antioxidant ones [ 17]. For instance, p-hydroxybenzoic acid has been isolated from many sources including carrots ( Daucus carota) [ 18] and protocatechuic acid from onion, garlic, and relatives ( Allium spp.) [ 19].
